creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
The reason is most likely a cell that is not allowed to wrap or a long url as
decribed in http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=175799 (applies to MSIE too)

What about <http://ant.apache.org/faq.html>?

No IE here, sorry (well, there is this crappy IE on my iBook, but I don't like
starting it ;-).

I don't see any problems with Mozilla.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
hauser@acm.org
text:
on my Laptop Mozilla, it fits!
But this is cheating ;) many people will no longer be able to read this
minuscule non-proportional font.

And sure enough, with PC MSIE6, it doesn't work - the culprit is still the line 
'("^\\s-*\\[[^]]*\\]\\s-*\\(.+\\):\\([0-9]+\\):\\([0-9]+\\):[0-9]+:[0-9]+:" 1 2 3)

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
I think it is more important to retain the formatting of the code example than
to avoid the scrollbar.
